How to Survive in Jungle

Know Your enemy

If you know the enemy and know yourself, you need not fear the result of a hundred battles.

Poisonous Plant

  • Plant life can be a valuable source of food energy and nutrition in any survival scenario.
  • But If you choose the wrong one, you're dead

Animals

  • In the jungle, you can take your pick from thousands of creatures that could harm or kill you.
  • If you're into mammals, everything from wild boars to jaguars and cougars can pose a threat.
  • If insects are your thing, you've got scorpions, brown recluse spiders and fire ants to consider

Water-related illness

  • Jungles are wet places, and sometimes being wet can be dangerous.
  • Trench Foot/Immersion Foot are some of them. Make sure to keep your feet dry

Mosquito-related illness

  • Mosquitoes in the jungle can infect you with malaria, West Nile virus, Dengue fever or yellow fever.
  • Malaria is the worst of the bunch, killing more than 1 million people per year.

What Should we do in order to Survive

Finding Water Source

  • If you have a container to store water, simply angle a leaf into it overnight or during a rainstorm
  • and you have some fresh drinking water in no time
  • If you find a stream, don't just start drinking; it could contain parasites that can make you seriously ill
  • You should purify the water by boiling it over a fire

Food Selection

  • Avoid plants with white or yellow berries.
  • Avoid plants with thorns.
  • Avoid anything with an almond smell.
  • You should purify the water by boiling it over a fire

Finding Food

  • We can do it by :
  • - Fishing
  • - Eating Insects
  • - Eating Fruits

Finding Food

  • We can do it by :
  • - Fishing
  • - Eating Insects
  • - Eating Fruits

How to Fish?

  • make two intersecting crosscuts at one end about 6 inches (15 cm) deep, creating four prongs.
  • separate the prongs by wedging vine into the crevices.
  • sharpen the prongs with a knife or sharp rock.

    • Selecting location for Shelter

  • stay near a source of water if possible
  • avoid natural hazards like dead trees and cliffs

    • Making a Shelter

  • simply tie the poncho or plastic between four trees to form a canopy
  • fashion a tent shelter by running rope down the center of the poncho between two trees and staking the sides into the ground using sticks to create an A-frame
